byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti and Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS FANDOS and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

abstract: Sidney Blumenthal, longtime adviser to Hillary Rodham Clinton, is deposed in closed-door session of House committee investigating 2012 attack on diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya; identifies CIA official Tyler Drumheller as person who wrote dozens of intelligence memos about Libya that Blumenthal passed on to Clinton; committee chairman Rep Trey Gowdy has raised questions about accuracy of memos.
lead_paragraph: Sidney Blumenthal reportedly testified before the Benghazi committee hearing that dozens of memos he sent Hillary Rodham Clinton when she was secretary of state were written by a longtime high-ranking C.I.A. official.

headline.main: House Benghazi Committee Examines the Origins of Emails to Clinton
headline.print_headline: Panel Examines the Origins of Emails to Clinton

snippet: Sidney Blumenthal reportedly testified before the Benghazi committee hearing that dozens of memos he sent Hillary Rodham Clinton when she was secretary of state were written by a longtime high-ranking C.I.A. official.
